questions.question: What is the main goal of synthesizing chiral porous inorganic materials from chiral porous metal–organic framework precursors?
questions.answer: The main goal is to transpose the chirality and porosity of the chiral porous metal–organic framework precursors onto the final crystalline inorganic frameworks.

questions.question: What method is commonly used in zeolite synthesis to attempt imprinting chirality of a molecule onto the inorganic framework?
questions.answer: Chiral templating by addition of an organic molecule or a cation to the synthesis medium is commonly used.

questions.question: At what temperature does the water molecule coordinated to Er2 in [Er4(Hhedp)3(H2O)2] get released?
questions.answer: The water molecule coordinated to Er2 is released at approximately 450 1C.

questions.question: What is the formula of the purely inorganic pyrophosphate material formed at approximately 700 1C from [Er4(Hhedp)3(H2O)2]?
questions.answer: The formula of the purely inorganic pyrophosphate material formed is [Er4(PO3–O–PO3)3].

questions.question: What is the topology of the network formed by the [Er4(Hhedp)3(H2O)2] material?
questions.answer: The topology of the network formed by the [Er4(Hhedp)3(H2O)2] material is srs topology.

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption properties of the materials for N2, CO2, and CH4 are significant.
What significant structural transformation occurs to the Hhedp4- ligand in [Er4(Hhedp)3(H2O)2] upon heating to approximately 450 1C?
questions.answer: The Hhedp4- ligand decomposes around the central carbon atom by releasing the –OH and –CH3 groups, which are replaced by a C–H group, forming a new hybrid material.

questions.question: What is the predicted Raman intensity and wavenumber for the C–H stretching mode of the PO3[C(H)]PO3 fragment in the intermediate phase?
questions.answer: The C–H stretching mode of the PO3[C(H)]PO3 fragment is predicted to appear at 3080 cm-1, with a medium-strong Raman intensity.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis concept of transposing chirality and porosity from MOF precursors to inorganic frameworks may be extended to other chiral porous inorganic solids.
What does the presence of a single band with moderate intensity at approximately 3084 cm-1 in the Raman spectrum of the intermediate phase indicate?
questions.answer: It indicates the presence of the [PO3–CHQPO3] ligand in the intermediate phase.
